alert.note: Alert for Box Elder (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 11:21AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Bear River At Corinne affecting Box Elder County. .Snowmelt due to warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in increased river flows. For the Bear River...including Corinne...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bear River At Corinne. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Minor flooding will occur to agricultural land and associated roads adjacent to the Bear River near the Great Salt Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 15.6 feet, or near 8000 CFS. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM MDT Wednesday was 15.7 feet, or near 8200 CFS. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 15.4 feet, or near 7500 CFS, Monday morning. The river will then rise back above flood stage next Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.5 feet, or near 7900 CFS. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 02/20/1986. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday at 1200 PM MDT.
